meanings.sent1: The priest will consecrate the new church with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered to consecrate the burial ground as a sacred place.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to consecrate their secret hideout as the 'official' clubhouse.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering dedication to her craft consecrated her as a master artist.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual to consecrate the temple involved chanting and incense.

meanings.definition: To dedicate formally to a religious or divine purpose
meanings.sent1: The monks will consecrate the new monastery in a solemn ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to consecrate the new church to their patron saint.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to consecrate the new scratching post as its own personal property.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to charity consecrated her life to helping those in need.
meanings.sent5: The elders performed a ritual to consecrate the sacred ground for future generations.

meanings.definition: To make holy or set apart for a higher purpose
meanings.sent1: The ancient tradition was to consecrate the chosen warriors before battle.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony was held to consecrate the new king as the rightful ruler.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to consecrate the special recipe for only important family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece seemed to consecrate the gallery with its presence.
meanings.sent5: The sacred text was used to consecrate the temple for worship.
